TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .

The charge was based on the investigator ’s interviews with the girl ( T. ) , the girl ’s mother PERSON and a neighbour PERSON , as well as on the findings of the medical examination carried out on the victim on DATE . The applicant asked the investigator to arrange for a confrontation with the prosecution witnesses and the medical expert . On DATE the investigator refused his request . On DATE ORG upheld that decision as lawful , in the final instance .

CARDINAL . At the beginning of the trial , once the applicant learned that the witness PERSON and the medical expert were not present , he asked the court to secure their attendance . The judge replied “ Where shall I get them ? ” and refused his request .

CARDINAL . The applicant pleaded not guilty . He admitted that in DATE he had gone with T. to the village of GPE where they had spent TIME at his ex - wife ’s house but he denied having raped the girl .

CARDINAL . At the trial ORG confirmed that the applicant had raped her .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of aggravated rape , an offence under LAW ( v ) of LAW , and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . ORG considered that the applicant ’s guilt had been sufficiently established on the basis of the victim ’s statements , which were corroborated by the following evidence :

the findings of the medical examination carried out on DATE which described scars on T. ’s hymen . The scars might have been caused by impact of a hard object . It was not possible to establish when they had been caused ;

the written statement by the neighbour PERSON made during the pre - trial investigation . TIME DATE , PERSON whose flat was separated from that of the applicant ’s ex - wife by a partition – heard a girl shrieking and imploring her father to stop . The girl sobbed for a while . PERSON shouted at the applicant and told him to stop harassing the girl . At that time she thought that the girl was a daughter of the applicant , PERSON The sobs subsided but then the girl started crying again and begging her father to stop . the note written in a child ’s handwriting which stated that the author had been raped by “ Andryukha ” ( a diminutive of the applicant ’s first name ) . T. confirmed that she had written the note .
CARDINAL . In his statement of appeal the applicant complained , in particular , that the trial court had not secured the attendance of PERSON and the medical expert .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal . It held that the court ’s conclusions had had a substantial basis in the statements by the victim which had been corroborated by other evidence , in particular , the child ’s note , PERSON testimony “ before the court ” [ sic ] and the findings of the medical examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a new appeal hearing . It noted that the applicant had not been able to confront PERSON and the medical expert during the pre - trial investigation or in court . It found that the applicant ’s rights under LAW ( d ) had been infringed , quashed the conviction and ordered a new trial .

CARDINAL . It appears that on DATE ORG issued a new judgment in the applicant ’s case . However , a copy was not made available to the ORG . Although the applicant indicated his intention to lodge an appeal against it , he did not submit a copy of his statement of appeal . No further information about these proceedings was received .

CARDINAL . NORP Who gave [ him ] the address of ORG and when did it happen ?

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted the following handwritten statement to the ORG :

“ I inform you as follows : on DATE I was visited in remand centre no . CARDINAL , GPE , by my lawyer PERSON . She gave me the text and translation of the ORG ’s comments of DATE . I am exasperated by Mr NORP ’s letter of DATE and would like to state the following :
